keyword: how many calories is in a california roll
title: How Many Calories in a California Roll?
meta_description: Discover how many calories is in a california roll, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown for this popular sushi option.
h1: How Many Calories in a California Roll?
assumptions: Standard California roll (8 pieces, ~225 g total) with imitation crab, avocado, cucumber, sushi rice, nori seaweed, and rice vinegar; no extra sauces.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by restaurant, brand, portion size, rice type, and added ingredients like mayo or sesame seeds. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard California roll has about 255 kcal, with 38 g carbs and 9 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use brown rice instead of white

faqs.q: How many calories is in a california roll from a restaurant?
faqs.a: Typically 255 kcal for a standard 8-piece roll, but can vary by preparation.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a California roll?
faqs.a: About 38 g total carbs, including 3 g fiber, mostly from the sushi rice.

faqs.q: Is a California roll high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 690 mg per roll due to seasoned rice and soy elements.

faqs.q: How much protein in one California roll?
faqs.a: Approximately 9 g, primarily from the imitation crab filling.

faqs.q: Does avocado add many calories to a California roll?
faqs.a: Avocado contributes healthy fats (~5 g total fat), but keeps calories moderate at 255 kcal overall.
